name: Molten Core
description: Molten Core is the first raid in WoW Classic. Its mechanics are relatively simple, making it a great introduction for new players, and no special gear is required to start. However, some bosses and trash packs can be extremely dangerous if mismanaged (e.g., Lava Packs, Shazzrah, Golemagg the Incinerator, Majordomo Executus, Ragnaros). Your main goal as a new player is simple: survive the raid. To achieve this, read this guide carefully, listen to the Raid Leader, and don’t hesitate to ask questions if anything is unclear.

bosses.name: Lucifron
bosses.mainMechanic: Curses the entire raid; adds can Mind Control players.

spells.name: Impending Doom
spells.desc: Inflicts 2000 Shadow damage to nearby enemies after 10 seconds.

spells.name: Lucifron's Curse
spells.desc: Curses nearby enemies, increasing the cost of their spells and abilities by 100% for 5 minutes. This applies to all resources: mana, rage, and energy.

spells.name: Dominate Mind
spells.desc: Mind Controls a random player for 15 seconds.

spells.name: Cleave
spells.desc: 180° cleave hitting up to 5 nearby targets.

roles.desc: Be ready to decurse as soon as your Restorative Potion wears off.

bosses.strategy: Kill the adds first. Melee players must watch their positioning to avoid cleave. NO AOE or cleave abilities to avoid killing Mind-Controlled allies. Lucifron will apply curses to the entire raid a few seconds into the fight—use your Restorative Potion when you see the debuff.

bosses.name: Magmadar
bosses.mainMechanic: Covers the room with fire; avoid all fire patches, they deal heavy damage.

spells.name: Panic
spells.desc: Fears nearby enemies for 8 seconds.

spells.name: Lava Bomb
spells.desc: Targets a random enemy and launches a Lava Bomb, dealing 3200 Fire damage over 8 seconds.

spells.name: Frenzy
spells.desc: Increases his attack speed and damage.

spells.name: Lava Breath
spells.desc: A frontal breath attack dealing around 1100 Fire damage.

spells.name: Magma Spit
spells.desc: Deals 100 Fire damage plus an additional 75 Fire damage every 3 seconds for 30 seconds. Can stack up to 3 times on nearby enemies.

roles.desc: Coordinate a rotation of Tranquilizing Shot to remove Frenzy as soon as possible.
Keep Fear Ward on the main tank and reapply it when it fades. Precast Fear Ward on as many players as possible before the pull (warriors generally do not need it).

bosses.strategy: Pre-pot a Greater Fire Protection Potion (GFPP). Use another one if consumed. Melee should not engage until the first Panic is used. Casters and healers must spread out. Do not stand in fire patches.

bosses.name: Garr
bosses.mainMechanic: Dispels player buffs; using many low-value buffs to protect important ones or boon for this fight.

spells.name: Antimagic Pulse
spells.desc: Dispels magic effects from nearby enemies.

spells.name: Magma Shackles
spells.desc: Reduces movement speed by 40%.

spells.name: Immolate
spells.desc: Inflicts 760–840 Fire damage and an additional 380–420 Fire damage every 3 seconds for 21 seconds.

spells.name: Eruption
spells.desc: When they die, they explode, dealing 1850–2150 Fire damage to nearby enemies and knocking them back.

spells.name: Separation Anxiety
spells.desc: If too far from Garr, their damage increases significantly.

roles.desc: Use as many buffs as possible so important ones are less likely to be dispelled.

bosses.strategy: Adds must be tanked far from the boss; healers should focus on the add tanks. Kill Garr first. Do NOT AOE the adds once they reach 25% HP. The Garr tank will bring one add at a time to be killed safely. Melee should move out before an add dies to avoid being knocked back into enemy packs.

bosses.name: Baron Geddon
bosses.mainMechanic: Move away from the raid if you have Living Bomb.

spells.name: Living Bomb
spells.desc: Afflicts a random player who will explode after 10 seconds. When it explodes, the player is sent into the air and takes fall damage. THIS SPELL CAN CRIT.

spells.name: Ignite Mana
spells.desc: Removes 400 mana per tick and deals 400 damage to the target.

spells.name: Inferno
spells.desc: Fire AoE around him, dealing increasing damage with each pulse. Lasts 10 seconds.

roles.desc: Dispel Ignite Mana, prioritizing healers > casters > tanks > melee.

bosses.strategy: Prepot GFPP. Players with Living Bomb must move away from the raid (see position, go to the white dot). Melees should run away when he starts casting Inferno and stay out until it ends (the last tick can one-shot you).

bosses.name: Shazzrah

spells.name: Arcane Explosion
spells.desc: Deals 925 to 1075 Arcane damage to all nearby enemies.

spells.name: Shazzrah's Curse
spells.desc: Increases the magical damage taken by nearby enemies by 100% for 5 minutes.

spells.name: Gate of Shazzrah
spells.desc: Teleports to a random target and resets his threat.

spells.name: Magic Grounding
spells.desc: Reduces magical damage taken by 50% for 30 seconds.

spells.name: Counterspell
spells.desc: Counters the spellcasting of nearby enemies, preventing any spell from that school of magic from being cast for 10 seconds.

roles.desc: Dispel Shazzrah's Curse. Prioritize tanks and melee who are engaged.

bosses.strategy: Prepot a GAPP. The raid is divided into 3 groups: one big melee group (if you are a fresh 60 melee, you will stay out for this fight) and two groups of casters and healers. Healers must be spread evenly across the two caster/healer groups. One tank will be in each group. When Shazzrah teleports, run back to his previous position.

bosses.name: Golemagg the Incinerator
bosses.mainMechanic: Deals heavy damage to melee; watch your debuff stacks.

spells.name: Magma Splash
spells.desc: Applies a stacking fire damage debuff to melee attackers.

spells.name: Golemagg's Trust
spells.desc: Buffs the Core Ragers with +500 damage and +50% attack speed if they are nearby.

spells.name: Pyroblast
spells.desc: Targets a random player, dealing 2000 fire damage and applying a DoT that deals 200 damage every 3 seconds for 12 seconds.

spells.name: Earthquake
spells.desc: At 10% health, Golemagg starts casting Earthquake, dealing around 1400 damage per tick.

spells.name: Mangle
spells.desc: Reduces movement speed by 50% and deals 300 physical damage every 2 seconds.

bosses.strategy: Tank Golemagg in place and swap tanks to manage debuff stacks. Melee should stop attacking once they reach 6–7 stacks of the debuff.

bosses.name: Sulfuron Harbinger
bosses.mainMechanic: Kick Dark Mending, then nuke adds.

spells.name: Inspire
spells.desc: Buffs nearby allies, increasing their damage by 25% and doubling their attack speed.

spells.name: Hand of Ragnaros
spells.desc: Inflicts fire damage, knocks back, and stuns targets for 2 seconds.

spells.name: Flame Spear
spells.desc: Area-of-effect fire spell.

spells.name: Dark Mending
spells.desc: Heals an ally for 237,500 to 262,500 health.

spells.name: Dark Strike
spells.desc: Consecrates the caster's weapon, inflicting 1,026 to 1,134 additional damage on its next attack.

spells.name: Immolate
spells.desc: Deals fire damage to the target.

spells.name: Shadow Word: Pain
spells.desc: Inflicts Shadow damage to an enemy every 3 seconds for 15 seconds.

roles.desc: Be ready to kick or pummel Dark Mending; it has a short cast time.

bosses.strategy: The key to this fight is to kick/pummel Dark Mending. Assign one rogue and one warrior per add to interrupt the first or second cast. After that, cleave or AoE the adds to death, then kill Sulfuron.

bosses.name: Majordomo Executus
bosses.mainMechanic: Control the fight, always focus the new skull target. Avoid AoE or cleave.

spells.name: Aegis of Ragnaros
spells.desc: Absorbs 30,000 damage, reflects 250 damage on melee attacks, and heals himself to full.

spells.name: Magic Reflection
spells.desc: Reflects any spell cast. Lasts 10 seconds.

spells.name: Damage Shield
spells.desc: Reflects 100 damage on melee attacks. Lasts 10 seconds.

spells.name: Teleport
spells.desc: Teleports a player into the fiery pit and resets threat.

spells.name: Blast Wave
spells.desc: Deals fire damage to nearby enemies.

spells.name: Fire Blast
spells.desc: Deals fire damage to its target.

spells.name: Magic Reflection
spells.desc: Reflects any spell cast. Lasts 10 seconds.

spells.name: Damage Shield
spells.desc: Reflects 100 damage on melee attacks. Lasts 10 seconds.

spells.name: Blast Wave
spells.desc: Deals fire damage to nearby enemies.

spells.name: Shadow Bolt
spells.desc: Targets a random player and deals around 1,000 Shadow damage.

spells.name: Magic Reflection
spells.desc: Reflects any spell cast. Lasts 10 seconds.

spells.name: Damage Shield
spells.desc: Reflects 100 damage on melee attacks. Lasts 10 seconds.

spells.name: Heal
spells.desc: Can heal any other mob.

bosses.strategy: This fight is primarily about control. Flamewalker Elites cannot be CCed; they must be tanked or kited depending on group composition. Flamewalker Healers can be sheeped. Focus one add at a time and avoid cleaving to prevent breaking sheep. Pay close attention to the new skull target. After four adds die, remaining adds become immune to sheep. Mages and Warlocks must be very careful with Magic Reflection, as it can easily backfire.

bosses.name: Ragnaros
bosses.mainMechanic: Melees, be careful with knockbacks. Mana users should be aware of lava exit paths.

spells.name: Wrath of Ragnaros
spells.desc: Knocks back nearby enemies, deals fire damage, and reduces threat of enemies hit.

spells.name: Hammer of Ragnaros
spells.desc: Targets a random mana user and knocks back all other players around them.

spells.name: Magma Blast
spells.desc: Casts if no player is in melee range. Deals heavy damage and can one-shot any non-tank player.

strategy: Ragnaros is a three-phase boss. In a Hardcore environment, the goal is to kill him during the first phase.
Melees: pay close attention to your positioning and follow raid leader calls to avoid Wrath of Ragnaros. Manage your threat carefully when engaging.
Casters and healers: spread out across the room. Depending on raid size, you may be asked to pair up. In this case, stack on your partner.
If knocked back by Hammer of Ragnaros, DO NOT run into melee packs or the tank.

trash.name: Lava Elemental
trash.mainMechanic: Pyroclast Barrage - Deals 1500 fire damage over 6 seconds and stuns the target.
trash.strategy: Tank should face them away from the raid. For these packs, it's always good to prepot a GFPP.

trash.name: Firelord
trash.mainMechanic: Can summon Lava Spawns. Focus on killing the adds instead of Firelord.
trash.strategy: Interrupt Firelord's casts and prioritize the adds first. These shares spawn points with Lava Annihilator.

trash.name: Molten Giant
trash.strategy: Always linked with another Molten Giant or Molten Destroyer. Let the tank separate them before engaging.

trash.name: Molten Destroyer
trash.mainMechanic: Can easily nuke a non-tank, watch your threat.
trash.strategy: Deals around 1000 damage to nearby enemies. Hits fast and can perform an instant attack on its target.

trash.name: Ancien Core Hound
trash.mainMechanic: Applies a random debuff to the raid. Be ready to dispel.
trash.strategy: Tank should face it away from the raid group. Mages and Paladins should be ready to dispel.

trash.name: Core Hound Packs
trash.mainMechanic: All must die at the same time.
trash.strategy: Time for big AoE. Melees should spread their damage and focus the one with the most HP.

trash.name: Flame Imps
trash.mainMechanic: Let the tank build threat, casters unleash AoE, melees be ready to pick up any imp lost by the tank.
trash.strategy: They deal fire damage. Ideally, let the tank build enough threat so no imp escapes, otherwise it will burn your GFPP. If you AoE too early, it could lead to a wipe, so hold a bit before starting.

trash.name: Lava Surger
trash.mainMechanic: Charges the furthest player, knocking back all enemies in its path.
trash.strategy: Assign a hunter to soak the charge, or have everyone stack at the same point. Can also be banished.

trash.name: Lava Annihilator
trash.mainMechanic: Requires a taunt rotation; melees without plate armor should stay out.
strategy: Can easily nuke characters without plate armor, so rogues, feral druids, and shamans should stay out of this fight. Tanks and warrior DPS will use a taunt rotation; warriors should equip a shield.

trash.name: Lava Packs
trash.mainMechanic: Deadliest pack with Mind Control; focus Firewalker first, banish Lava Elemental or Lava Reaver.
strategy: This pack is even deadlier than some bosses. Good coordination is required.
Firewalker casts a 3000 fireball on a random target, can cast quickly and twice. If you have less than 6000 HP, consider it Russian roulette.
Flameguard has a fire aura; melees should stay out to avoid burning GFPP. Let casters handle it.
Lava Elemental casts 1500 fire damage over 6 sec and stuns if facing the raid. It can also hit its main target hard, so watch threat.
Lava Reaver hits hard non-melee tanks and cleaves.

On pull, casters should pre-cast on Firewalker to take it down fast. Warlocks will banish Lava Elemental and Lava Reaver. Once Firewalker is dead, handle mobs one by one. Prepot a GFPP and use another if you take fire damage.
